results.title: Hamlet (Kozintsev)
results.brief_description: In the opening sequence of this production the whole line of the film is boldly laid down. Hamlet gallops across the sands towards Elsinore, and into the great sombre castle; Claudius’ rule is proclaimed in the crowded courtyard; the drawbridge is slowly pulled up, shutting the castle in on itself. Where Kozintsev scores, consistently and impressively is through the elements outlined in the film’s vigorous introduction; the way he involves the onlookers of Elsinore in the action, and the way he uses the castle and the court to create a feeling of encirclement by iron, stone and the watchful eye of the courtiers. The emphasis is on speed, clarity, the flow of visual action. It cuts a firm, slashing line through the play.

results.title: King Lear
results.brief_description: Kozintsev approached the play by creating a total environment for his characters to dwell in - a vast no-man’s land of moor and marsh populated by small communities in primitive castles and clusters of farm dwellings. He has made a superb film which from its beginning portends a tottering natural order and is filled with true Shakespearian energy, a mood doubly enhanced by the splendid score by Shostakovich which lifts the film onto an epic plane. In Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Mission (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Roland Joffe, Fernando Ghia and David Puttnam
results.brief_description: A man of the sword. A man of the cloth. A clash of civilisations. A fight to the death. A political parable and portrait of 18th century missionary works. Shot on location in the breathtaking jungles of South America. “The Mission” is a movie experience to be shared by all. Stars Robert de Niro and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: Halloween (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Debra Hill and Falcon Film
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s much imitated Halloween defined the eighties stalk and slash genre, spawning inferior copies like the Friday the 13th series (including six sequels of it’s own) and for a time making star Jamie Lee Curtis into the premium ‘scream queen’. Later on the conventions of the genre were cleverly re-invented for a nineties audience by director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson in Scream, which pays direct homage to Halloween. John Carpenter opens his film with an unnerving point of view shot of the young psychotic Michael Myers brutally stabbing his teenage sister to death on Halloween night. Flash forward to Halloween 15 years later and Michael has escaped the mental institution he has been locked up in. Meanwhile shy, virginal teenager Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her girlfriends are preparing for Halloween, unaware of the menace that lurks in their quiet suburban community. Carpenter makes great use of the sparse, atmospheric music score (which he also composed) and uses to maximum creepy effect the white mask Michael Myers wears throughout the film. The film also established the classic horror genre rule if your a sexually active teenager, you die! Also staring: Donald Pleasence, P.J. Soles, Tony Moran.

results.title: Gallipoli (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A powerful, poignant military drama, “Gallipoli” focuses on the friendship of two young men (Mel Gibson and Mark Lee) in order to personalise the tragedy of the futile World War I Anzac campaign against the Turks. Excellent performance. Technically perfect.
results.description: A powerful, poignant military drama, “Gallipoli” focuses on the friendship of two young men (Mel Gibson and Mark Lee) in order to personalise the tragedy of the futile World War I Anzac campaign against the Turks. Excellent performance. Technically perfect.

results.title: The Neverending Story (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Dieter Geissler and Bernard Eichinger
results.brief_description: A young boy escapes the neighbourhood bullies by retreating into a mysterious book that takes him into a shimmering fantasy world of creatures, giant forests and massive oceans. It is an awesome world, but a world in decay, and its existence is being threatened. Rated: G.

results.title: More Winners: Boy Soldiers
results.creator_credit: Cliff Green, Mark Joffe, Margot McDonald, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Quartier Latin International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
In 1910 the Australian Government passed a law requiring all boys aged between 14 and 17 years of age to register for compulsory military training. Between 1911 and 1915, more than 30,000 boys were persecuted for failing to obey this law. This story tells of one such boy, Will Barnes, a 14 year old conscientious objector who refuses to register. After prosecution Will is sentenced to three months training at Fort Queenscliff. At the fort, Will refuses to wear a uniform or to be involved in any type of military training. Will meets a lot of opposition but also wins his share of admirers, for sticking to his beliefs.

Cast includes Tamblyn Lord, Nathan Croft, Bruno Lawrence, Nicholas Bell and Gary Sweet.

results.title: The Fourth wish
results.creator_credit: Don Chaffey, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A touching story about a father’s fight against all odds to attain the three wishes of his boy and of his own fourth wish. John Meillon is Casey, the father with the amazing determination to achieve the last three wishes of his dying son. You will like Casey. When the chips are down he’s got the guts to get in there and have a go. He’s taking on the world - for the sake of his son. He has to! He has three very important things to achieve and if it means bucking the system, he’ll do it to win.

results.title: The Great Land of Small
results.brief_description: Tonight, in a quiet forest, Jenny and David are about to embark on a mystical, magical adventure. Aided by Fritz, a kindly hobbit like creature, they are about to enter the enchanted World of Small. Once inside, the kids discover the Kingdom of Small is a place of beauty and wonder and happiness, where no one grows old. Unfortunately, Jenny and David are told that they cannot return home and only Fritz’s special magic can help them. Rated: G

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Ken Hughes, Albert R. Broccoli, Dramatic Features and Warfield Productions
results.brief_description: James Bond author, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. The film version is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family. It stars Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe and is recreated for the screen by the director of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.
